qas.question: What is the color red associated with?
What political party is the color blue associated with?
Did the political parties choose those colors?

answers.text: unlike political color schemes of other countries, the parties did not choose those colors

qas.question: In what year did the occurrence of using different color schemes for the parties stop?
What color was chosen by the Democratic Party before 2000?
Before 2000 what color did the Republican party choose to be associated with?
What have international political parties not chosen for themselves since 2000?
What happened when other countries violated political color scheme norms in 2000?
What did parties in other countries alternate to avoid confusion in 2000?

context: Political color schemes in the United States diverge from international norms. Since 2000, <b5_0>red<b5_0/> has become associated with the <a0_0>right-wing Republican Party<a0_0/> and <b4_0>blue<b4_0/> with the <a1_0>left-wing Democratic Party<a1_0/>. However, <a2_0>unlike political <b6_0>color schemes<b6_0/> of other countries, the parties did not choose those colors<a2_0/>; they were used in news coverage of 2000 election results and <b7_0>ensuing legal battle<b7_0/> and caught on in popular usage. Prior to the <a3_0>2000<a3_0/> election the media typically alternated <b8_0>which color represented which party<b8_0/> each presidential election cycle. The color scheme happened to get inordinate attention that year, so the cycle was stopped lest it cause confusion the following election.
